TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TransformedBitmap extends System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource implements class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize

remarks.format:
## Remarks TransformedBitmap supports only orthogonal transforms such as rotation transforms of 90Â° increments and scale transforms. Transforms that skew the image are not supported.
TransformedBitmap implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. Property changes can only occur during object initialization. Call <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> to signal that initialization has begun and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.EndInit%2A> to signal that initialization has completed. After initialization, property changes are ignored.
TransformedBitmap objects created using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.%23ctor%28System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Transform%29> constructor are automatically initialized and property changes are ignored.
Metadata tags related to image data must be updated if an image is saved to a file after a transform is applied.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. To initialize a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Property initialization must be done between BeginInit and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls. Once the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
